metadata.titel_preek: Trinity Sunday & Second Sunday After Pentecost

locutie.beschrijving: The preacher provides a psychological analogy for the Trinity (the desperate parent) and a liturgical history of the Book of Common Prayer regarding sin.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong. Connects the 'fullness' of the 2 Cor benediction to the specific crisis in Corinth and explores the 'fear of the Lord' in Psalm 130.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting theological truths and explaining biblical contexts, with a shift toward blessing/benediction at the conclusion of sections.
voorbeelden: This is the position in which the apostle Paul finds himself.
The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness.
I may leave you today with renewed confidence.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Comfort through the realization of God's relentless love; humility through the acknowledgment of sin.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Moderate. The Spirit is mentioned as part of the Trinitarian formula, but not explicitly as the agent of the sermon's current effect.

voorbeelden: God’s love spends itself to the very last drop.
This is no dry scholarly doctrine.
The psalm itself is a clear demonstration.
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.
The love that is with us even into the last ditch.
commissieven.kwaliteit: The promises are largely quoted from the text rather than directly spoken as a new promise from the preacher to the congregation.

voorbeelden: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ... be with you all.
I may leave you today with renewed confidence.
declaratieven.autoriteit: High. Uses the apostolic benediction to perform the grace it describes.

indicatoren: Extensive 'talking about' the history of the Prayer Book.
Describing Paul's feelings rather than enacting Paul's authority.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a theological reality rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the promise ('God promises YOU')
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Intellectual agreement without the 'jolt' of a sacramental event.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Strong when present, but often framed as a quote of the text.
voorbeelden: The grace... be with you all.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Used to include the preacher in the human condition ('we').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address in the 'Imagine' and 'Reflect' sections.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used mostly for directives (mental exercises) rather than commissives.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Paul, the Corinthians, the Psalmist, and God.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere for the middle 50% of the text.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Historical context of Corinth and the 1976 Prayer Book.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological definitions of God's love and sin.

actueel_present.gebruik: The final benediction and the 'I leave you' statement.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the depth of sin (Assertive) to the promise of mercy (Commissive/Declarative).
voorbeelden: May God grant... that we all together might go forth in the joyous knowledge.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is present but softened by the descriptive 'talking about' the Psalm.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: With the Lord there is mercy... therefore you shall be feared.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is highly educational and orthodox, but it functions more as a commentary on the 'event' of the text rather than being the event itself.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ... be with you all.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: In the version that we used until 1976...
zwakke_punten.probleem: Stops the flow of the 'event' to give a lecture on prayer book revisions.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is a 'gebeuren' (event) only in the final moments; the rest is a preparation for the event through explanation.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The authority is derived from the liturgy rather than the preacher's own illocutionary courage.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicitly, through the reading of the Psalm.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, especially in the 'I may leave you' section.
tekstueel_bewijs: I may leave you today... invoking with renewed faith the apostolic blessing.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher prays for God to 'grant' the effect, acknowledging it is not her own work.
tekstueel_bewijs: May God grant that not a single one of us...

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Partially; the sermon points to the 'means of grace' rather than being the primary one.
tekstueel_bewijs: Human love is a glimmer of the full radiance of God’s love.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 'is' and 'was' verbs; needs more 'I/God [action] you' verbs.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The idea that we can add up our virtues... is decisively repudiated.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: I repudiate, in the name of Christ, any attempt you make to add up your virtues.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a theological fact to a pastoral act.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often 'about' the Psalmist's experience.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Directly apply the 'plenteous redemption' to the specific 'depths' of the congregation.
voorbeeldzinnen: To you, in your specific depth, God promises: I will not let you go.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Third-person distance in the middle section.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'You' more frequently when discussing the 'miserable offender' status.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are that child on the verge of self-destruction; God is that parent.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually quite good.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Ensure the 'fear of the Lord' is presented as a gift, not just a duty.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is theologically rich and pastorally sensitive, but it leans heavily on the 'constative'—explaining the grace rather than always being the vehicle of it. Strengthening the 'Declarative' voice will turn this from a good lecture into a powerful event.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies that the 'Benediction' isn't just a 'relationship signal' but a reality-altering declaration.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The focus is not on the 'parent' metaphor's persuasiveness, but on whether the preacher has the authority to speak for God.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is concentrated in the final paragraph, while the middle section is 'constative surplus' that could be tightened.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ... be with you all.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Excellent; it is the sacramental peak.

appendices.notities: The preacher uses 'May God grant' which is a 'Precative' (a prayerful directive to God), which is a humble way of handling perlocution.
